content.2: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for
content.3: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.
content.4: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
content.5: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.
content.6: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.
content.8: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no
content.10: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
content.11: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
content.13: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;
content.14: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:
content.15: So that my soul chooseth strangling,
content.19: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
content.20: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?
content.21: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I
